details.description: The "handling=strict" and "handling=lenient" preferences indicate, at the server's discretion, how the client wishes the server to handle potential error conditions that can arise in the processing of a request.
The "respond-async" preference indicates that the client prefers the server to respond asynchronously to a response.

The "return=representation" preference indicates that the client prefers that the server include an entity representing the current state of the resource in the response to a successful request. The "return=minimal" preference, on the other hand, indicates that the client wishes the server to return only a minimal response to a successful request.
The "wait" preference can be used to establish an upper bound on the length of time, in seconds, the client expects it will take the server to process the request once it has been received.
